description: I’m deeply engaged in AI alignment and existential risks, concerned that advanced models might drift from their intended goals, so I monitor safety research breakthroughs—methods, benchmarks, and protocols—empirical experiments that reveal misalignment, policy and regulatory updates, and documented failures or accidents across sources like the AI 2027 blog and Guardian reporting to spot early warning signals. I’m also interested in quantum computing’s practical and scientific applications and their broader societal, economic, and ethical impacts.
userInterests: The user is deeply concerned about the risk of inadvertently creating a misaligned AI. They want to monitor news on technical capability leaps, new safety and alignment research, corporate development and policy shifts, regulatory updates, and real-world AI incidents. Their motivation is to catch early warning signs and stay informed so they can advocate for or implement effective safeguards.

curatedArticles.title: ‘I think you’re testing me’: Anthropic’s new AI model asks testers to come clean
curatedArticles.trailText: Safety evaluation of Claude Sonnet 4.5 raises questions about whether predecessors ‘played along’, firm says

curatedArticles.title: AI models may be developing their own ‘survival drive’, researchers say
curatedArticles.trailText: Like 2001: A Space Odyssey’s HAL 9000, some AIs seem to resist being turned off and will even sabotage shutdown

curatedArticles.title: OpenAI throws caution to the wind, and a year of covering Elon Musk
curatedArticles.trailText: The AI company’s app Sora makes a bigger splash than Meta’s Vibes. Plus, everything I learned about the Tesla CEO in the past 12 months

curatedArticles.title: Chatbot site depicting child sexual abuse images raises fears over misuse of AI
curatedArticles.trailText: Child safety watchdog calls for child protection guidelines to be built into AI models from the outset

curatedArticles.title: Labour cosies up to US tech firms with little thought of downsides | Heather Stewart
curatedArticles.trailText: Economic benefits of generative AI, which may take time to show, put ahead of impact of datacentres on energy and water

curatedArticles.title: Nvidia to invest $5bn in Intel after Trump administration’s 10% stake
curatedArticles.trailText: Deal gives Intel a lifeline as firms team up on AI datacenters and PC chips after Trump stake sparks market surge

curatedArticles.title: More than a million people every week show suicidal intent when chatting with ChatGPT, OpenAI estimates
curatedArticles.trailText: Finding is one of most direct statements from the tech company on how AI can exacerbate mental health issues

curatedArticles.title: OpenAI relaxed ChatGPT guardrails just before teen killed himself, family alleges
curatedArticles.trailText: Adam Raine’s suicide at 16 years old was ‘predictable result of deliberate design choices’ by OpenAI, his family says

curatedArticles.title: US regulators launch investigation into self-driving Teslas after series of crashes
curatedArticles.trailText: NHTSA reported Teslas driving through red traffic lights and driving against direction of travel during a lane change

curatedArticles.title: Nvidia to invest $100bn in OpenAI, bringing the two AI firms together
curatedArticles.trailText: Deal will involve two transactions – OpenAI will pay Nvidia for chips, and the chipmaker will invest in the AI startup

curatedArticles.title: Harry and Meghan join AI pioneers in call for ban on superintelligent systems
curatedArticles.trailText: Nobel laureates also sign letter saying ASI technology should be barred until there is consensus that it can be developed ‘safely’

curatedArticles.title: ChatGPT ‘upgrade’ giving more harmful answers than previously, tests find
curatedArticles.trailText: Campaigners ‘deeply concerned’ about response to prompts about suicide, self-harm and eating disorders

curatedArticles.title: Governments are spending billions on their own ‘sovereign’ AI technologies – is it a big waste of money?
curatedArticles.trailText: Many US-built AI systems fall short but competing against tech giants neither easy nor cheap

curatedArticles.title: Do OpenAI’s multibillion-dollar deals mean exuberance has got out of hand?
curatedArticles.trailText: Some market watchers are concerned by the circular nature of deals with chip makers Nvidia and AMD

curatedArticles.title: OpenAI signs multibillion-dollar chip deal with AMD
curatedArticles.trailText: The deal gives the ChatGPT maker the option to take a 10% stake in the chipmaker

curatedArticles.title: California police stumped after trying to ticket driverless car for illegal U-turn
curatedArticles.trailText: San Bruno officers pull over Waymo but say a ticket wasn’t issued, as ‘citation books don’t have a box for “robot”’

curatedArticles.title: ‘Sycophantic’ AI chatbots tell users what they want to hear, study shows
curatedArticles.trailText: Scientists warn of ‘insidious risks’ of increasingly popular technology that affirms even harmful behaviour

curatedArticles.title: AI could make it harder to establish blame for medical failings, experts say
curatedArticles.trailText: Report raises concerns about liability issues and lack of testing as development of AI health tools booms

curatedArticles.title: ‘Obedient, yielding and happy to follow’: the troubling rise of AI girlfriends
curatedArticles.trailText: AI dating sites claim they remove potential for exploitation, but critics say they are reinforcing harmful stereotypes

curatedArticles.title: Labour plans to consult on use of live facial recognition before wider roll-out
curatedArticles.trailText: Policing minister says government will ‘put some parameters’ around its deployment in England

curatedArticles.title: From South Park v Trump to AI slopaganda: deepfakes are now part of the news cycle, for better and for worse | Anna Broinowski
curatedArticles.trailText: Deepfakes come with risks that demand urgent regulation. But it is vital their potential as a creative and satirical tool isn’t stifled

curatedArticles.title: UK startup Wayve begins testing self-driving tech in Nissan cars on Tokyo’s streets
curatedArticles.trailText: London-based AI pioneer in talks to receive $500m investment from Nvidia as it funds its expansion in the US, Germany and Japan

description: The user is personally curious about the fields of protein folding and nuclear fusion, driven by their potential to revolutionize healthcare through disease treatment and to provide sustainable energy solutions. This interest is fueled by the transformative impact these advancements could have on the future of humanity.
